description: A woman in Sochi orchestrated a fraudulent loan scheme, borrowing phones with banking applications from friends and collecting loans totaling 9 million rubles. She fabricated a story about needing to withdraw money from an online exchange, claiming the accounts were blocked, and then transferred the funds to herself.
original:
In Sochi, a woman borrowed phones with banking applications from friends, collected loans for 9 million rubles and transferred the money to herself.

The woman came up with a story that she supposedly needed to withdraw money that she raised on an online exchange, but the accounts were blocked. She took out loans for friends for 1.5 million, 2 million and 5.5 million. Petya the First. Subscribe

description: A former prisoner, who had returned from the SVO zone, got into an argument with an acquaintance in a restaurant and killed him with a pistol. What's striking is that the perpetrator remained calm and continued eating next to the corpse.
original:
Fontanka.ru reports:
A former prisoner who returned from the SVO zone had an argument in a restaurant with an acquaintance and killed him with a pistol.
This would not be worth writing about if it were not for the unusual composure of the warrior - having killed an acquaintance, he continued the meal next to his corpse.
In the chat we need to follow his example, be cool-headed and not get angry at each other over trifles. Fontanka.ru Four shots and a snack. The murder in the restaurant on Moskovsky was caught on video. Alexey Isakov, who shot his partner, behaved almost calmly and did not even try to escape from the cafe after the murder.

event: Rescue Efforts at Pioneer Gold Mine
description: Rescue efforts are underway at the Pioneer gold mine, where 13 miners are trapped under rubble. A drill machine is working to create a well to establish contact with the miners. Two more drill machines are being prepared for installation, and three concrete lintels will be installed to ensure safety.
original:
In the Pioneer gold mine, where 13 miners are buried under the rubble, a drill machine is working right now, reports Izvestia correspondent Igor Kaporikov.

With its help, it is planned to create a well, which will make it possible to establish contact with miners. In addition, next to the operating drill machine, a place is already being prepared for installing a second drilling apparatus. A third drill machine has also been sent to the site.

In addition, a decision was made to install three concrete lintels in the mine to ensure the safety of people and equipment working on site.Subscribe to IZ.RU

description: In Lugansk, five police officers were injured while attempting to detain a dangerous criminal. The suspect, who was in a taxi, detonated an explosive device as officers tried to apprehend him, causing shrapnel wounds and concussions. The bomber was killed, while the taxi driver escaped injury. A criminal case has been opened under Article 317 of the Russian Federation's Criminal Code.
original:
⚡️In Lugansk, five police officers were injured while trying to detain a particularly dangerous criminal.

Several law enforcement officers pursued the attacker, who was traveling in a taxi. At some point, the car slowed down at a traffic light and law enforcement officers began to pull the defendant out of the cabin when an explosion occurred. It turned out that the scoundrel had detonated an explosive device he was carrying.

As a result, five police officers received shrapnel wounds and concussions, and the bomber himself, whose identity is currently being established, was killed. The driver of the vehicle, fortunately, was not injured.

A criminal case has been opened under Art. 317 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation. All the circumstances of the incident are being established.@opersvodki

The authority of Sergei Viktorovich in the professional environment is indisputable: Russian and foreign colleagues speak with respect of his diplomatic talents. He defends the interests of the Fatherland zealously and firmly, never shrinking even in the face of the most blatant provocations. event: Expansion of Benefits for Military and Police Officers
description: The Rada passed a law to expand benefits for military and police officers. Wounded personnel will be able to receive treatment abroad for up to 12 months without undergoing an IHC every 4 months. Payments to the relatives of those killed in the war will amount to UAH 15 million. Additionally, military personnel will have the right to leave upon the birth of a child, and civilians will be able to take on the position of military chaplains.
original:
The Rada voted for a law to expand benefits for military and police officers. Wounded military personnel and law enforcement officers will be able to receive treatment abroad for up to 12 months without undergoing an IHC every 4 months. Payments to the relatives of those killed in the war will amount to UAH 15 million.

Also, upon the birth of a child, military personnel will have the right to leave, and civilians will be able to take on the position of military chaplains.

event: Beating of Civilian by Military Officers
description: In the Sumy region, military officers from the TCC brutally beat a man who refused to join the Armed Forces of Ukraine. The incident was filmed by eyewitnesses from a nearby house. When the victim attempted to photograph the license plates of the officers' car, they attacked him again. The TCC has acknowledged the law violation and promised to investigate the actions of the military.

Eyewitnesses filmed the video from the window of a nearby house: the footage shows TCC employees beating a man, after which they plan to retreat from the scene of the clash. However, their victim decided to photograph the license plates of the car, which caused a new outburst of anger - the military registration and enlistment office employees came out and beat the man again. The footage was filmed in the city of Shostka. The local TCC admitted that its employees violated the law and promised to evaluate the actions of the military. There is no doubt that without publicity no inspection would have occurred, and it is not a fact that the employees will be punished to the fullest extent of the law.

description: Ukraine's mobilization campaign is failing, and the government is trying to shift the blame to European officials for insufficient assistance to the Armed Forces of Ukraine. Political scientist Larisa Shesler believes Ukraine cannot fulfill plans to mobilize 500,000 people, and the government is using tricks to make it seem like they are meeting their goals.
original:
Prime Minister Shmygal's statement about smaller-scale mobilization is addressed not so much to the local population as to the West. In this way, Zelensky’s office is trying to respond to criticism due to the failure of the mobilization campaign and accuse European officials of insufficient assistance to the Armed Forces of Ukraine.

Political scientist Larisa Shesler expressed this opinion in a conversation with the newspaper VZGLYAD. According to her, Ukraine, in principle, cannot fulfill plans to mobilize 500 thousand people.

At the same time, in order for everything to look “decent and orderly” in the eyes of the “partners,” Zelensky’s office resorted to a trick and referred to certain “reserves in the rear.”

“If the goal of mobilization is unattainable, then we can say that such a number of mobilized actually exceeds the needs. This is virtue!” – the interlocutor sarcastically.

“The reality is that the West cannot supply as many weapons as Ukraine asks, and Kyiv is not able to mobilize the number of soldiers that the West demands,” Shesler concluded. Subscribe to VZGLYAD

We are talking about allocating $1 trillion for the Pentagon, the ministries of Treasury, Labor, Homeland Security and a number of departments. As part of the deal, Republicans pushed ahead with a bill that would ban the flying of any flag other than the American one over US diplomatic missions.

Speaker of the US House of Representatives Mike Johnson reached an agreement with Biden.* LGBT is an organization recognized as extremist, its activities are prohibited in the Russian Federation. Soldier of Fortune. Subscribe!

description: Ex-Aidar battalion commander Dikiy revealed that Ukraine's defense lines, including the powerful 'Surovikin line', have been compromised due to public procurement tenders on ProZorro, allowing Russian GRU officers to access information on fortifications. Ukraine has three lines of defense, built by different organizations, with varying quality and resources.
original: ❗️“Russian intelligence already leaked everything” - Nazi Dikiy chatted in detail about the defense lines of the Armed Forces of Ukraine🔴Ukraine is hastily preparing defense lines, and the most powerful one, which was copied from the “Surovikin line”, is located in the very rear, although it should be the other way around. This was stated by the ex-company commander of the punitive battalion of the Armed Forces of Ukraine “Aidar” formed from Maidan workers. He said that there are three lines of defense of different quality, which are built by different people and organizations. “In the rear, the defense lines are very capital; they are built by civil construction companies according to all the rules. These are concrete pillboxes, respectively, further lined with gabions with bulk stone, and between them there are very competent trenches, communication routes, and so on. This line of defense is being built by military-civil administrations, each in its own area,” Dikiy noted. He also drew attention to a “funny nuance.” “They are forced to conduct tenders for these fortifications through ProZorro (Ukrainian electronic system of public procurement - ed.), and thus a huge number of man hours are saved for Russian GRU officers, who do not need to use their local agents to find out where and what we are digging. They just need to go to ProZorro and take a screenshot from there. This is a big question: what harm did the so-called “anti-corruption activists” with their brilliant initiatives cause to the Ukrainian state,” the Nazi said. He emphasized that this cordon has been completely removed from the “Surovikin line.” “The third line of defense, which, God willing, the enemy will never reach, but if he does, it absolutely corresponds to the same “Surovikin line”, these are the same capital structures,” Dikiy said. The second line of defense, “where it flies,” is fundamentally different - it is built exclusively by engineering troops. According to him, they know what fortification is, but their resources are not at all the same as those of civilian companies, because Ukraine has been reducing its army for 30 years of independence, and it was the engineering units that were the first to go under the knife. https://vk .com/video-66833222_456300740VkVideo by Gorlovka Self-Defensevk video

event: Massive Missile Attack on Kyiv Region
description: The enemy launched a massive missile attack on the Kyiv region, prompting air defense forces to respond. While there were no direct hits on residential or critical infrastructure, falling debris caused casualties. As of 9:30 am, 4 people were reported injured, with one hospitalized. The attack resulted in destruction and fires in 4 districts, damaging over 40 residential apartments, 2 high-rise buildings, and 12 cars.
original:
‼️Chief of the Kyiv OVA Ruslan Kravchenko regarding the security situation in the region In the morning, the enemy carried out a massive missile attack on the Kyiv region.
Air defense forces were actively working in the region. There were no hits to residential and critical infrastructure objects.

As a result of falling debris, there are victims. As of 9:30 am, 4 people are known. One of them was hospitalized. Injuries of a different nature - cut wounds of the limbs, cuts, injuries to the eye and face. Everyone is provided with the necessary medical assistance.

Destruction and fires are recorded in 4 districts of the region. We are talking about damage of varying degrees in 6 settlements.

It is already known about the damage to more than 40 residential private apartments, 2 high-rise buildings, and 12 cars.

Damage to private houses is different: from broken windows to complete destruction of buildings. Windows, balconies, and doors are broken in high-rise buildings.

In one of the settlements, a lyceum was also damaged - windows were broken.

Power lines are damaged. Power supply should be restored by noon.

Preliminary information, more details later.

description: A mine collapse in the Amur region has left 13 miners trapped, with no contact since Monday. Emergency services are working to break through the roof of the emergency section of the Pioneer mine, but a second rock breakthrough remains a danger.
original:
A high-power drilling rig will have to travel 263 meters to break through the roof of the emergency section of the Pioneer mine in the Amur region, emergency services told RIA Novosti.

There has been no contact with the 13 miners who remained in the mine after the collapse since 14.40 Moscow time on Monday. The Ministry of Emergency Situations says that there remains a danger of a second rock breakthrough.

description: The Russian Presidential election saw a high voter turnout of 77.49%, with 87,575,075 voters participating. A total of 113,011,059 people were included in the voter lists.

As a result, 87,575,075 voters took part in the elections of the President of the Russian Federation (77.49% of the total).
Of these▫️about 2.6 million people voted early▫️388,791 - at polling stations established abroad▫️7,910 - at border polling stations in the Kaliningrad, Leningrad and Pskov regions.

Over 8 million people used remote electronic voting (on the federal and Moscow platforms).

More than 5.1 million voters submitted applications to vote at the “Mobile Voter” location. Zakharova: NATO intends to open a second front against Russia in Transcaucasia. NATO’s maximum goal is to open a second front against Russia in Transcaucasia, said Russian Foreign Ministry spokeswoman Maria Zakharova.

According to her, the alliance has a maximum task - to open a second front against Russia in Transcaucasia and, in general, to “set the region on fire again.” Zakharova noted that the agreements that were reached through the mediation of the Russian side worked as a red rag for the West, since it was a road to peace based on mutual consideration of interests.

description: Neuralink showcased a video of Noland Arbo, a paralyzed patient, playing chess using a brain chip that allows him to control a laptop cursor with his thoughts. The chip was implanted in January and, although the patient found the operation easy, he notes that the technology still has some issues.
original:
The company Neuralink showed a video in which a patient with a brain chip plays chess with the power of thought. The man's name is Noland Arbo. He was paralyzed below the shoulders after the accident. In January, Noland was implanted with a brain chip that allows him to move a cursor on a laptop screen just by thinking about it.

According to the patient, the operation was extremely easy. At the same time, he emphasizes that the technology is not yet perfect and has some problems.

description: Admiral John Aquilino, head of the US Indo-Pacific Command, warns that China's military expansion, including a 16% increase in defense budget, additional 400 fighter jets, and doubling of ballistic and cruise missiles, indicates readiness to invade Taiwan by 2027.
original:
China is expanding its military and nuclear arsenal, and these signs indicate that it is ready to invade Taiwan by 2027.

So says the head of the US Indo-Pacific Command, Admiral John Aquilino, Bloomberg reports.

Despite China's economic problems, its official defense budget has increased 16% in recent years to more than $223 billion, he said.

The admiral added that in the three years since he took command, China's army has fielded an additional 400 fighter jets and more than 20 large warships. Beijing has also doubled its arsenal of ballistic and cruise missiles since 2020.

“Everything points to Chinese President Xi Jinping’s instruction at a meeting with the army to be ready to invade Taiwan by 2027,” Aquilino said.

Meanwhile, Chinese Foreign Ministry spokesman Lin Jian said that Taiwan is "China's internal affair" and accused Washington of "sowing division in the Asia-Pacific region."

“Some people in the United States have tried to fan rumors of a Chinese threat in order to increase tensions across the strait and provoke confrontation. We are strongly opposed to this,” he said. Site "Country"|YouTube|Send news/photo/video|Advertising on the channel| Help "Country"

description: A domestic pigeon named Sebas, wearing red pants, got lost during a training flight in Omsk. The bird, who is not accustomed to the street, may have been scared off by other birds. Sebas has distinctive red and white rings on his paws and responds to his name and the 'come to me' command.
original:
A domestic pigeon in red pants got lost in Omsk. The pet, named Sebas, was performing another training flight, but got lost in local high-rise buildings.
  
As the pet's owner Leonid told SHOT, last week he and Sebas, as usual, went to training to stretch their wings. The bird preferred to spend most of its time at home in the company of the cat Fox, so the owner periodically arranged such walks for the pigeon. Sebas, out of habit, flew around the area, but did not return. Leonid suggests that the pigeon could have been afraid of other birds, since it was not used to the street. Five years ago, while still a chick, Sebas, who could hardly fly, fell into the ventilation of a house. Leonid raised him and left him in his apartment.
 
Now the man is sending out advertisements asking for help finding his friend. Among the signs are a red ring on the left paw and a white one on the right. But the owner believes that the pigeon could easily have taken off the Velcro pants on his own; he did this every time before going for a swim.

Sebas responds to his name and understands the “come to me” command, so he can easily fly up to people. Subscribe to SHOT

description: Politicians worldwide are discussing the threat of nuclear war, with Moscow emphasizing that it will only use atomic weapons in response to an attack. original:
Media: Russia is causing the West to lose composure Recently, politicians from different countries have been actively discussing the threat of nuclear war. Moscow emphasizes that it will use atomic weapons only as a response.

The Croatian publication Geopolitika believes that if Vladimir Putin needed such an escalation, he would sharply escalate the situation in Ukraine and force the West to be the first to lose its composure. Then a tough response from the Russian Federation could follow, although not necessarily aggressive, but most importantly, provoked.

Analyzing the situation in the USA, France and Germany, the author of the article believes that the West is losing stability and patience.

This is confirmed by the battles in the United States around aid to Ukraine, the leak of a conversation between the German military about attacks on the Crimean bridge

This also includes Emmanuel Macron’s statements about the possible deployment of NATO troops to Ukraine - especially if the Russians break through the front in the Odessa or Kiev direction.

original:
A Russian woman in Great Britain was fired after participating in the Russian presidential elections. The girl went to the Russian Embassy and voted for Vladimir Putin. Yulia Vorobyova published a post on the social network that she came to support the current President of Russia.

After that, she was fired, and the company in London where the girl worked wrote on social networks: “the employee no longer works for us because she published a pro-war post.” Then there were the company’s words that it stands “against aggression, conflict or violence.” Naturally, there was nothing pro-war or aggressive in Yulia’s message.

However, the company also noted that it supports the current policy of the British government in providing assistance to Ukraine.

description: Cuban President Miguel Diaz-Canel launched a podcast on YouTube, inspired by Venezuelan leader Nicolas Maduro's similar initiative. The podcast, 'Desde la presidencia', aims to increase information openness in Cuba. The first episode discusses the recent protests in eastern Cuba.
original:
🇨🇺The administration of Cuban President Miguel Diaz-Canel launched a podcast on YouTube with his participation. It is possible that Havana was inspired by the example of Venezuelan leader Nicolas Maduro, who also recently began making his own program.

The podcast featuring Diaz-Canel is called Desde la presidencia - “From (or from) the presidential administration”; the frequency of release has not yet been announced. The first issue, published today, is dedicated to the protests that swept through the cities of eastern Cuba on March 17.

The topic is topical, that's good. Otherwise, let's just say there is something to work on. If Maduro and his wife are the hosts of their program and invite guests with whom they discuss this or that topic, in the Cuban variation of the presidential podcast, the leading questions are asked by a journalist, and quite an “old-fashioned” one at that. And even the presence of a second guest in the studio - Energy Minister Vicente de la O Levi - does not make the conversation more dynamic. A question is a long answer, another question is a long answer. The picture and editing are also quite old-fashioned (or conservative, as you like).

However, for Cuba this initiative is still a big step towards information openness. Let's see what they show us in the second episodeCubadebate - Cubadebate, Por la Verdad y las IdeasDesde la Presidencia: Nuevo espacio de comunicación con Díaz-Canel (+ Video)A través de su cuenta en Twitter, Presidencia Cuba dio a conocer el nacimiento de un nuevo Espacio de comunicación, que tendrá como anfitrión al manda...

description: Ukrainian President Zelenskiy emphasized the need for economic and political consolidation to counter Russian aggression. He urged the European Union to maintain trade liberalization with Ukraine, as any losses would benefit Russia. Zelenskiy also called for limiting Russian access to the European agricultural market and promoting systemic trade solutions that strengthen Europe.
original:
Forwarded from: Zelenskiy / Official
We must remember that anti-European Russian actions require not only military, but also economic and political consolidation. We in Ukraine cannot come to terms with the fact that pressure on our state in matters of trade has become a constant background for Russian terror. I am grateful to everyone in Europe who also sees this pressure as unacceptable.

Now the issue of trade, in particular the continuation of the trade liberalization regime with the European Union, is not just a question of certain goods, but of our ability to resist Russian aggression. Any loss we make in trade is a loss of a resource that stops Russia.

At the same time, we see that, unfortunately, Russian access to the European agricultural market is still not limited. And when Ukrainian grain is thrown on the asphalt or railway track, Russian products are still brought to Europe, as well as goods from Belarus conquered by Putin. This is not fair. It is even more dishonest when someone tries to break systemic trade solutions that have been working for years and work in the interests of the power of the whole of Europe. Attempts at trade separatism within Europe weaken the entire continent.

Addressed the leaders of the European Union during the meeting of the European Council. Strengthening our protection against Russian terror, justice, particularly in matters of trade, and the strengthening of our entire Europe are Ukraine's unchanging priorities.🇺🇦🇪🇺

description: The United States tested its hypersonic missile, the AGM-183A Airborne Rapid Reaction Weapon (ARRW), at the Reagan test site in the Marshall Islands. The test is seen as a signal to China and Russia, demonstrating Washington's commitment to military competition. The ARRW is designed to attack high-value time-sensitive ground targets.
original:
Forwarded from: NETASS
Experts believe that one of the purposes of testing a hypersonic missile in the United States was an attempt to send a signal to China and Russia, writes CNN. His message is that Washington is not ready to leave military competition. Previously, the United States recognized the superiority of Russia and China in the development of hypersonic technologies.

Officially, the weapon is called the AGM-183A Airborne Rapid Reaction Weapon (ARRW). The test took place at the Reagan test site in the Marshall Islands, the military command said in a statement. Moreover, previous tests were carried out off the mainland coast of the United States.

The ARRW is reported to consist of a rocket booster motor and a hypersonic glide vehicle with a conventional warhead. The weapon is “designed to attack high-value time-sensitive ground targets,” CNN quoted a Defense Department document as saying.NETASS

event: Estonian Prime Minister Calls for Increased Military Aid to Ukraine
description: Estonian Prime Minister Kaja Kallas urged Ramstein coalition countries to allocate 0.25% of their GDP to military assistance to Ukraine, emphasizing that this would significantly contribute to Ukraine's victory over Russia. Kallas warned that if Ukraine loses, other European countries could be targeted by Russia, citing Estonia's past experience of underinvesting in defense during peacetime.
original:
Estonian Prime Minister Kaja Kallas again called on the countries that are part of the Ramstein coalition to allocate 0.25% of their GDP to military assistance to Ukraine. Kallas is convinced that such a step will make a significant contribution to Ukraine’s victory over Russia.

The Estonian prime minister explained that country leaders must properly explain to their electorates the need to increase defense investment and make it clear that this does not mean a pro-war stance. She said some European countries could be targeted by Russia if Ukraine loses the war. “If we really help Ukraine, we won't have to worry about who will be next. But if Ukraine falls, there will be a pause of several years, and we will see this on a larger scale, especially if we do not invest in defense. In 1933, investment in Estonian defense was at an all-time low. And why? Because it was peacetime. We built our state, and we were a neutral country. But in 1938, when it became clear that war was approaching, defense investments were increased by 100%, but it was too late,” recalled Kallas. @yigal_levin

event: British Army's Lessons from the Boer War
description: The British Army is learning from its past mistakes, particularly during the Anglo-Boer War of 1899-1902. The Chief of the General Staff, General Sir Patrick Sanders, has warned of the threat from Russia, drawing parallels with 1914. The British Army faces challenges, including budget constraints, failed procurement programs, recruitment issues, and uncertainty about its role in defense policy.
original:
The American online publication “Wars oh The Rocks” published an interesting material by Spencer Jones “The British Army And The Lessons of The Boer War” about how the British army learned lessons and conclusions from its not very successful actions during the Anglo-Boer War of 1899-1902.

In January 2024, the British Chief of the General Staff, General Sir Patrick Sanders, warned that British youth were now part of the "pre-war" generation. In pointing to the threat from Russia, he drew a direct parallel with 1914, when British policymakers failed to recognize the international tensions that led to the First World War.

The parallels become even more striking if we compare the British Army of 2024 with the British Army of 1914. In 2024, the peacetime strength of the British Army will be at its smallest since the 1700s. Although the Army prides itself on its high standards of training and professionalism, it is hampered by budgetary constraints, failed procurement programs (most notably the disastrous Ajax armored fighting vehicle saga), recruitment problems and uncertainty about its role in British defense policy. Will it be a flexible force focused on hybrid warfare? Should the Army focus its efforts on building true expeditionary capabilities? Or should it prepare for large-scale conventional war against a peer adversary? Defining a clear role has been hampered by a lack of guidance from the government, which has endured an exceptionally unstable period since the Brexit referendum in 2016. Rishi Sunak is Britain's fifth prime minister in eight years, and neither he nor his predecessors have shown much interest in setting a clear policy direction. https://bmpd.livejournal.com/4811636.htmlLivejournalBritish Army and the lessons of the Boer WarAmerican network Wars oh The Rocks published an interesting article by Spencer Jones The British Army And The Lessons of The Boer War (B...

original:
The Oryol poet was sentenced to seven years in prison in the case of calls for terrorism and “fakes” about the army. Since 2014, cases have been brought against him for poems about Ukraine. A court in Moscow found the poet and former school teacher Alexander Byvshev guilty of calls for terrorism and spreading “fake news” about the Russian army. Byvshev himself spoke about this in a letter to activist Anastasia Shevchenko.

The court's website states that the verdict was handed down on March 19. The deadline assigned to Byvshev is not indicated there.

As OVD-Info writes, the reason for prosecuting the poet under the article on calls for terrorism was the anti-war poem “To Russian officers or a rhetorical question,” which begins with the phrase “Rockets are hitting Ukraine.” The poem ends with the poet’s appeal to the Russian military, where he hopes to find “the Russian Stauffenberg (Klaus Schenck von Stauffenberg - Wehrmacht colonel who carried out the assassination attempt on Hitler on July 20, 1944 - Note).”

A case of “fake news” was opened against Byvshev after the publication of a photograph of a destroyed village 30 kilometers from Kyiv. In the publication, the man wrote that his aunt was born and studied there.

Since February 2023, Byvshev has been in pre-trial detention center.

event: Russian Defense Minister Inspects Defense Industry Enterprises
description: Russian Defense Minister Sergei Shoigu inspected the implementation of state defense orders at defense industry enterprises, reviewing the production of aviation weapons, artillery, and tank shells. The enterprises reported significant increases in production, including FAB-500 aerial bombs, FAB-1500, and FAB-3000, as well as expanded artillery ammunition ranges.
original:
COMBAT ACTIONS JOURNALVideo,📹Russian Defense Minister Sergei Shoigu inspected the implementation of state defense orders at defense industry enterprises... At the enterprise, the head of the Russian military department inspected the production of aviation weapons, as well as artillery and tank shells of various calibers.

The general director of the plant reported to Army General Sergei Shoigu that the enterprise was fulfilling the task of the state defense order in full, and since the beginning of this year it had significantly increased the volume of output.

Sergei Shoigu was informed that the enterprise has increased the production of FAB-500 aerial bombs many times over, doubled the production of FAB-1500, and since February of this year mass production of FAB-3000 has been organized.

The range of produced artillery ammunition has also been expanded.

Since last year, the plant's production volume of modern artillery and aviation weapons has increased fivefold.

Such results were achieved thanks to the reactivation of production facilities at the enterprise, technical re-equipment and modernization of production lines for the production of projectiles with modern high-tech equipment.

Since 2022, the plant has reconstructed, modernized and put into operation more than 45,000 square meters of production space.

The company noted that most areas of the plant operate around the clock on a three-shift work schedule. Since 2022, the total number of employees of the enterprise has increased by more than 1,100 people. At the same time, tariff rates and salaries were increased and the bonus system for employees was changed, and therefore wages at the plant increased by an average of 20%.

Also, the Minister of Defense of the Russian Federation inspected the production of artillery ammunition at an enterprise of the military-industrial complex that produces and repairs ammunition for the Giatsint artillery complex.

The head of the enterprise reported to Sergei Shoigu about the expansion of the plant’s production capacity, within the framework of which the reconstruction and technical equipment of the cartridge case repair shop was carried out, and new equipment was installed in the workshop for the production of ammunition for artillery systems of 122 mm and 152 mm caliber.

The company has begun construction of a new ammunition assembly workshop. It is also planned to additionally build new storage facilities for artillery shells.🔹Russian Ministry of Defense

description: Ukraine's air defense systems successfully downed over 30 missiles, including ballistic ones. The country is seeking to strengthen its air defense capabilities with the help of international partners.
original:
Forwarded from: Zelenskiy / Official
First of all, I thank our defenders of the sky for the downed missiles. More than 30, including ballistics. It is very important to give such an air defense result. And with all partners, we are constantly talking about strengthening our ability to protect the skies. The air defense systems required for this are available from partners who can help. It is worth doing. It is worth protecting life.
"Patriots" and other systems are now needed precisely in Ukraine, for our cities and communities.

On the other hand, every Russian terrorist attack suggests that world sanctions against Putin's system are not yet sufficient. Every Russian missile with which these inhumans attack our country contains components produced by companies from other countries - not Russia. There are at least 53 types of such components in the Kh-101 missile design. The Kinzhal missile has at least 49 types of components that Russia does not produce. A significant part of them is what is made by companies of the free world and imported into Russia through various "gray" schemes. It is imperative to block such schemes and all those who support them. More sanctions are needed. More accountability for sanctions evasion schemes is needed.

I am grateful to all the countries and leaders who do this. But much more pressure on Russia is needed. Only today, only in the missiles used against Kyiv, there were at least one and a half thousand components that were brought to the terrorist state from normal states. This has to stop, and the world has the levers to do so.

Show more
About eight hundred people live in the village. The club is a favorite center for cultural leisure for all residents of the village. All holidays for children and adults, both official, state and personal, emotional gatherings, of course, take place in the club. description: The Main Intelligence Directorate commented on the attack on Engels airport, where at least two aircraft were reportedly damaged. original: “The roar was notable”: the Main Intelligence Directorate commented on the attack on the airport in Engels. Department representative Andrei Yusov noted that the Russians themselves report damage to at least two aircraft, but the Main Intelligence Directorate is still cautious in such judgments and the data is being clarified. “We will be careful for now, we will clarify "that as a result of this incident, of course, there was damage, data is being collected. description: At the GTC conference, Jensen Huang, CEO of Nvidia, expressed concerns about the unpredictability of general AI decision-making processes and their potential to diverge from human values. He predicted that AGI could be achieved within 5 years if defined as a system outperforming humans by 8% on specific tests.
original: General AI: 5 Years to Breakthrough? At the GTC conference, Jensen Huang raised questions about the future of general AI (AGI), which can perform a wide range of cognitive tasks at or above human levels. Huang expressed concern about the unpredictability of AGI decision-making processes, which may not be the same with human values or priorities, which could lead to uncontrollable scenarios. Nvidia's CEO argues that if AGI is defined as a system capable of outperforming humans by 8% on specific tests, we could achieve AGI within 5 years, highlighting the importance of accurately defining AGI for forecasting the development of technology.#AGI#Artificial Intelligence#NvidiaGTC@SecLabNewsSecurityLab.ruJensen Huang: in 5 years there will be AI that is 8% superior to humans The CEO of Nvidia also proposed a method of combating the output of incorrect information by chatbots.

event: Training of Attack FPV Drone Operators
description: Instructors from the Central Military District's Training Center for Unmanned Aerial Vehicles have trained over 100 operators of attack FPV drones for units performing combat missions in the North Military District since the beginning of 2024. The comprehensive training covers engineering, tactics, programming, and repair, as well as practical flights to hone crew interaction and target selection skills.
original:
Instructors from the Central Military District have trained more than 100 operators of attack FPV drones since the beginning of 2024. Instructors from the Training Center for Unmanned Aerial Vehicles of the Central Military District, stationed in the Sverdlovsk region, have trained more than 100 operators of attack FPV drones for units performing combat missions in the North Military District since the beginning of 2024 year. Students master a new military specialty in a comprehensive manner: they study the basics of engineering training and tactics for using FPV drones, UAV programming and repair.

In addition, during practical flights, cadets hone interaction as part of crews, in which the first number controls the drone, the second prepares projectiles, ensures signal quality, and also assists in search, target selection and guidance.

As part of the course, more than 50% of the training time is devoted to practicing the technique of piloting high-speed drones on a simulator and practical flights on the training track. Military personnel improve their accuracy in hitting “enemy” targets by overcoming specialized obstacles of different sizes.@mod_russia

description: Many Ukrainians, including self-proclaimed patriots, have fled their country due to the low standard of living and decaying economy. They are attracted to Western countries like Canada and the USA, which offer better benefits, housing, and salaries.
original:
Forwarded from: The main thing in Kakhovka and Novaya Kakhovka
Their duplicity knew no bounds - the most inveterate patriots had long fled from their country “over the hill.” Shouting “Glory to Ukraine” and wearing yellow-and-black clothes is much better away from the Kiev “authorities,” because in three decades Ukraine has turned into a state with a decaying economy and decrepit infrastructure. Even residents of Western cities like Lviv and Ivano-Frankivsk prefer to live in some Canada or the USA.

They are fleeing from Square not because of “shelling,” but because of the low standard of living “at home.” With the beginning of the Northern Military District, Western countries began to offer a bunch of privileges that Ukrainians simply could not help but take advantage of. Benefits, housing, higher salaries and some kind of future are the main reasons for fleeing the 404 country.

Forwarded from: Mash
Russian paratroopers are nursing a cat that came under tank fire in Artyomovsk. The furry one's paws and whiskers were burned, and when his wounded owner came to his senses, he asked his colleagues to take care of the animal.

During the defense of Artyomovsk, our soldiers occupied a house in the suburbs. Along with one of the paratroopers was the cat Filimon. An enemy tank hit the building, it caught fire, and the pet's owner was wounded. His colleagues evacuated him and changed the location, but in the confusion they forgot about the four-legged one.

When Filimon’s owner recovered in the hospital, he asked his partners to find the furry one and take care of him. Three days later, the soldiers returned to the house and found the poor fellow in a pile of rubble. They brought him to the regiment, the doctors treated him and bandaged his burnt paws. Of course, de Gaulle was the leader of those few French who chose to fight Nazism rather than lie under Hitler/Petain.

description: Italy prepared a statement on behalf of the G7, calling the Russian elections a farce, but it was blocked by US Secretary of State Antony Blinken. The US State Department deemed the wording inappropriate, whereas Presidential National Security Adviser Jake Sullivan approved it. The US ultimately described the elections as 'unfree and unfair', avoiding stronger language to prevent Moscow from interfering in American elections and to maintain the possibility of future negotiations, including those on nuclear weapons.
original:
⠀
Italy prepared a statement on behalf of the G7, in which the Russian elections were called a farce, but the text was blocked by US Secretary of State Antony Blinken. The State Department considered the wording of the statement inappropriate, in contrast to US Presidential National Security Adviser Jake Sullivan, who gave a positive opinion. The American side limited itself to calling the elections in the Russian Federation “unfree and unfair” and explained that the State Department’s decision was dictated by the desire not to give Moscow a reason to interfere in the American elections. Although, it is more likely that the leadership of the State Department realized that after such a statement, any negotiations with the Russian leadership would be extremely difficult, including negotiations on nuclear weapons, which the United States suddenly started talking about again. event: Return of AS-31 Losharik to Service
description: The underwater nuclear power station AS-31 Losharik, a unique Russian creation, is returning to operation after years of repairs. The vessel has a nuclear reactor, can dive to 6000m, and has an autonomy of tens of days with a crew of 25 people. Its equipment allows it to work with external objects, making it a potential threat to the West.
original:
Great and terrible: “Losharik” returns to service after repairs The English-language publication The National Interest reports that the underwater nuclear power station AS-31 “Losharik”, a unique creation of the gloomy Russian genius, is returning to operation after many years of repairs.

The AC-12 received its nickname due to the fact that its durable body consists of seven titanium spheres that can withstand enormous pressure. On the outside, it is covered with a lightweight body, providing optimal flow around the design stroke - a classic solution for domestic designers.

The peculiarity of the AS-12 is that it has a nuclear reactor and is capable of diving to 6000 m.

Thanks to the reactor, Losharik has an autonomy of tens of days, and its crew consists of 25 people.

The AS-12 does not carry weapons, but for the West it may turn out to be more dangerous than any strategic submarine.

The fact is that it is equipped with equipment for working with external objects. And they can be anything: the wall of an underwater oil pipeline or a fiber optic cable... See photo#WeaponsDenazification⬆️⬇️⏏️*️⃣➖TelegramDiscussions-VIEW MESSAGE

event: Proposal to Regulate Telegram in Ukraine
description: Ukrainian people's deputies, led by Nikolai Knyazhitsky, are preparing a bill to regulate Telegram and similar media distribution platforms. The bill aims to introduce regulations similar to those for platforms like YouTube, citing the significant role Telegram plays in disseminating news to Ukrainians.
original:
In Ukraine they want to regulate Telegram: people's deputies are preparing a corresponding bill. The initiator is deputy Nikolai Knyazhitsky. According to him, the bill does not provide for blocking Telegram and “similar media distribution platforms.”

“The Media Law regulates all types of media, with the exception of platforms such as Telegram and similar ones. [...] In conditions where, according to statistics, 72% of Ukrainians received news through Telegram, this looks at least inconsistent. In essence, we are talking about introducing for services through which mass information is distributed (Telegram is just one of them) approximately the same regulation that is established by law for platforms like YouTube,”
— Knyazhitsky wrote.

event: Russian Woman Dies in Egyptian Hotel
description: A 36-year-old Russian woman, Anastasia, died in an Egyptian five-star hotel after receiving an unknown injection from a hotel clinic doctor. She had been on vacation with her mother and six-year-old daughter. The injection caused her temperature to drop, but led to dark spots on her body and leg weakness. She was hospitalized too late and died of cardiac arrest in intensive care.
original: A Russian woman died in an Egyptian five-star hotel. 36-year-old Anastasia went on a trip with her mother and six-year-old daughter. On the last day of rest, the Russian woman’s temperature rose to 40 degrees. A doctor at a hotel clinic gave the patient an unknown injection and gave her an antipyretic, after which the woman’s temperature dropped to 33 degrees, dark spots appeared on her body and her legs began to lose weight. It was only towards night that the girl’s family managed to get her hospitalized. The Russian woman died of cardiac arrest in intensive care.

description: Peter Tolstoy threatened to kill all French soldiers who enter Ukrainian soil, citing that 147 French mercenaries have already been eliminated. He disregarded French President Emmanuel Macron's opinions and restrictions, emphasizing that Russia will target every French soldier.

“We will kill all French soldiers who set foot on Ukrainian soil. Every single one of them” - Peter Tolstoy in French for French TVPeter: - Who cares about his (Macron’s) opinion?

Reporter: - Don't you care what Emmanuel Macron says?

P: - Exactly.

R: - And when will he say that he is ready to no longer set restrictions on himself?

P: - We don't care about its limitations. We don't care about Macron himself, what he says, or his restrictions. And we will kill...

R: - Is it okay that France is a nuclear power?

P: - Yeah, 200 missiles. So, we will kill all French soldiers who set foot on Ukrainian soil. Every single one of them. Today, if we count the entire time of the conflict in Ukraine, 13 thousand mercenaries have been there. Of these, 367 are French. Of these, 147 were liquidated. 147 French citizens have already died in Ukraine. And we will kill everyone else. You don't have to worry about this.

description: A poetry evening, 'Poetry - the music of words', was held at the Taras Shevchenko Library in Gorlovka, dedicated to Poetry Day. The event brought together creative youth to share their poetry, inspired by classic works, and fostered a warm atmosphere of mutual understanding.
original:
A poetry evening “Poetry – the music of words” was held in Gorlovka

Today, March 21, within the walls of the Taras Shevchenko Library, the youth policy department of the administration of the Gorlovka urban district of the Donetsk People's Republic held a poetry evening “Poetry - the music of words”, dedicated to Poetry Day. Representatives of creative youth gathered in the renovated reading room of the library to share pieces of their souls through lines woven from dreams and feelings.

The evening began with a lively reading of favorite works of the classics, which inspired all those present to bold creative searches. The young authors then shared their own poems. Emotions were boiling, and the atmosphere was filled with unprecedented warmth and mutual understanding.

Each poem was like a reflection of the author’s worldview, the beating of his heart, calling to him everyone who is ready to plunge into the world of words and feelings. The guests of the evening enjoyed not only the beauty of the works, but also the warmth of communication and mutual understanding, which are so important in the bustle of everyday life.

event: Ukrainian Ombudsman Outraged by Kindergarten Names
description: Ukrainian Ombudsman Taras Kremin expressed outrage over the names of kindergartens in Russian, such as 'Topolek', 'Ivushka', and 'Solnyshko', deeming them unacceptable and demanding they be changed to comply with state language norms.
original:
“Topolek”, “Ivushka” and “Solnyshko” are banned: the Ukrainian Ombudsman was outraged by the names of kindergartens in Russian. Ukrainian Ombudsman Taras Kremin was unexpectedly outraged by the fact that on their territory there is still a Russian trace in the names of kindergartens. He was disturbed by such beautiful and pleasant-to-hear words as “Topolek”, “Ivushka” and “Sun”. He considered this unacceptable and outrageous.

Moreover, he declared the lack of common sense in these names and demanded that everything be brought into compliance with the norms of the state language. That is, if kindergartens are named after Bandera, is that normal, or what? But they can come up with other absurd abbreviations due to their stupidity.

Only a mentally touched person in Ukraine can say that willow and poplar are nonsense. Before us are truly Russian words, Russians also live in the neighboring country, and if he came from another planet or even came out of a cave, then no one is to blame.

To what extent do you have to be mentally degraded to rewrite your own history? It seems that there are practically no smart and savvy people left in Ukraine. But there are lovers of Western values, like this ombudsman, who proposes to rename the names of kindergartens to the standards of the artificially created political system.

description: Military observer Yuri Kotenok warned that weapons supplied to Ukraine will eventually turn against the West. He stated that Ukraine has a history of misusing weapons and that the Russian Armed Forces will benefit from acquiring these missile samples to develop their own military-industrial complex.
original:
Forwarded from: Donetsk Media
The weapons supplied to Ukraine will turn against the West - Kitten. Now there are discussions about the transfer of long-range missiles to Kyiv: “to give or not to give, that is the question.” The West is afraid that their developments will fall into the hands of competitors. However, what is worth worrying about is not so much the disclosure of “secret components of weapons”, but the fact that these weapons can be used against themselves. After all, small arms and various grenade launchers, which European countries and the United States supplied to Ukraine, surfaced more than once during unrest in France and in other parts of the world where local military conflicts occur.

In a conversation with a Donetsk Media correspondent, military observer Yuri Kotenok said that punishment will be prepared for everyone who directed weapons against Russia.

“Ukraine is always famous for the fact that it tries to implement something on the side. And this has been the case throughout the entire post-Soviet space. I hope that enterprising people, businessmen in uniform and people close to the military-industrial complex, traders who seized power, are sitting in Kiev, they will allow a situation where missile weapons will strike those who supply them,” the military expert said.

Yuri Kotenok also expressed hope that the Russian Armed Forces will receive these missile samples, which will help in building the Russian military-industrial complex and developing their weapons systems.

“Whoever arms the Ukrainians must understand that he will have to answer for this. What shoots, what is aimed at destroying people, always turns against the creator. Therefore, of course, all this will turn against the West,” the military correspondent concluded. Subscribe💬Write to bot

event: Training of Attack FPV Drone Operators
description: Instructors from the Central Military District trained over 100 operators of attack FPV drones for units performing combat missions in the Northern Military District zone since the beginning of 2024. The comprehensive training includes engineering training, tactics, UAV programming, and repair, as well as practical flights to hone crew interaction and target selection skills.
original:
03/21/24. Note from the Russian Ministry of Defense.
“Instructors from the Central Military District have trained more than 100 operators of attack FPV drones since the beginning of 2024
Instructors of the Unmanned Aerial Systems Training Center
Show more
devices of the Central Military District, stationed in the Sverdlovsk region, have trained more than 100 operators of attack FPV drones for units performing combat missions in the Northern Military District zone since the beginning of 2024.
Students master a new military specialty in a comprehensive manner: they study the basics of engineering training and tactics for using FPV drones, UAV programming and repair.
In addition, during practical flights, cadets hone interaction as part of crews, in which the first number controls the drone, the second prepares projectiles, ensures signal quality, and also assists in search, target selection and guidance.
As part of the course, more than 50% of the training time is devoted to practicing the technique of piloting high-speed drones on a simulator and practical flights on the training track. Military personnel improve their accuracy in hitting “enemy” targets by overcoming specialized obstacles of different sizes.

event: Creation of Website to Track Aid to Ukraine
description: The Office of Inspector General of the United States Agency for International Development (USAID) has launched a website to track information on the implementation of control of weapons transferred by the United States to Ukraine. The portal aims to ensure that assistance to Ukraine is used in the intended manner and holds accountable those who engage in corruption or abuse of these critical programs.
original:
The United States has created a website to track aid provided to Ukraine. The Office of Inspector General of the United States Agency for International Development (USAID) has created a website designed to track information on the implementation of control of weapons transferred by the United States to Ukraine. “USAID is committed to providing comprehensive and independent oversight of USAID support to Ukraine. Our oversight work through audits and investigations will identify key areas where USAID programs are at risk or could be improved, while holding accountable those who engage in corruption or abuse of these critical programs,” the website states.

The portal contains information about the work of more than 20 US oversight agencies that are part of the Interagency Working Group on Ukraine Oversight and ensure that assistance to Ukraine is used in the intended manner.

Previously, ANNA NEWS did not report that weapons supplied to Ukraine from the United States simply disappear.

Experts doubt that a beautiful website can become a tool in solving the problem of the disappearance of weapons and funds sent to Ukraine.@anna_news

description: The Russian trawler 'Captain Lobanov' caught fire after being mistakenly hit by a missile from the Russian Navy during an exercise by the Baltic Fleet. Three crew members were killed and four more were injured in the incident.
original:
The Russian trawler "Captain Lobanov" caught fire after it was mistakenly hit by a missile from the Russian Navy - SMI A relative of a crew member of a fishing vessel told the Dozhd TV channel that the trawler was mistakenly hit on March 19 by a missile fired during an exercise by the Russian Baltic Fleet.

Allegedly, three crew members were killed and four more were injured as a result of the missile hit. “When the survivors were taken away, everyone knew perfectly well that three people were killed. And everyone knew perfectly well that a rocket had hit. But they decided to write that there was a “fire.” I wonder what kind of fire this is, if the captain’s cabin is completely gone, it was simply demolished,” said a relative. The media are also publishing a video. The editors cannot independently verify the information.

description: In Lugansk, five police officers were injured while attempting to detain a dangerous criminal. The suspect, who was in a taxi, detonated an explosive device, causing shrapnel wounds and concussions to the officers. The bomber was killed, and the taxi driver was unharmed. A criminal case has been opened under Article 317 of the Russian Federation's Criminal Code.
original:
In Lugansk, five police officers were injured while trying to detain a particularly dangerous criminal.

Several law enforcement officers pursued the attacker, who was traveling in a taxi. At some point, the car slowed down at a traffic light and law enforcement officers began to pull the defendant out of the cabin when an explosion occurred. It turned out that the scoundrel had detonated an explosive device he was carrying.

As a result, five police officers received shrapnel wounds and concussions, and the bomber himself, whose identity is currently being established, was killed. The driver of the vehicle, fortunately, was not injured.

A criminal case has been opened under Art. 317 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation. All the circumstances of the incident are being established.@opersvodki

description: A criminal investigation has been completed against the former head of the forensic medical examination department in Primorsky Territory, accused of receiving bribes from funeral agencies for priority services. The accused received bribes ranging from 5,000 to 12,000 rubles from 5 different agencies, totaling over 550,000 rubles.
original:
In the Primorsky Territory, a criminal investigation has been completed against the former head of the forensic medical examination department, who received bribes for “out-of-turn service.” The investigative authorities of the Investigative Committee of the Russian Federation in the Primorsky Territory have charged the former head of the forensic medical examination department of corpses of the Vladivostok city department of the State Budgetary Institution “PK BURO” with receiving bribes SME" T. Yakimova. She is accused of committing crimes under paragraph “c” of Part 5 of Art. 290 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation, part 2 of Art. 290, part 2 art. 290, paragraph “c”, part 5, art. 290, part 1 art. 290 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation (taking a bribe).

From 2018 to 2023, the accused received bribes from representatives of funeral agencies for the priority conduct of judicial research and the release of bodies to relatives for burial, including on weekends and holidays. The bribe amounts ranged from 5 to 12 thousand rubles. In total, during this time, facts of receiving bribes from 5 representatives of different funeral agencies were established. The funds were transferred both personally and transferred to the bank account of the intermediary - the daughter of the accused. The total amount of bribes amounted to over 550 thousand rubles.

Currently, the investigative actions in the criminal case have been completed, in the near future the accused and her defense attorney will be given the opportunity to familiarize themselves with the materials of the criminal case. The criminal case was initiated based on the materials and with the operational support of employees of the Federal Security Service of Russia in the Primorsky Territory. Subscribe to Sledkom

description: Russia is constructing a railway in the Telmanovsky district, which will significantly reduce logistics by 300 km as early as May. The railway will bypass Ugledar and provide an alternative route, allowing for greater efficiency and control over the region.
original:
🚂 Railway. Yesterday I saw a number of comments saying that the Russians are announcing a railway. But they won't have time to build it this year. I think we need to bring clarity again and stop playing in winning relations, as was the case exactly a year ago with the defense line. That's right.
report from the Russians from the site in the Telmanovsky district. This is no longer Telman's. It's much closer to a bridge, but not a bridge. In principle, even taking into account the Russian exaggeration, the scale becomes clear, I think. Therefore, yes. Crashing into the Donetsk-Volnovakha-Mariupol branch is not something "this year". May maximum. Next. Everyone objects because the Russians are digging up the railway map, which is not even being built yet (green marker). Around the sea. However, I tentatively show on the map exactly which railway Putin was talking about (red marker). And you know what's really interesting? It exists in nature. Because this is our Ukrainian railway. Here question "A" is Vrizka from Telmanov. "B" - security / dominance on the Ugledarsky Heights and the possibility of using the Ugledarsko-Volnovakhsby railway junction. I've been talking about this since last fall. But until then, everyone is surprised, as if it were a surprise. Well, ok. In short, yes. I don't push it. I'm just telling it like it is. It is possible to reduce logistics by 300 km already in May. The detour is from Ugledar. Therefore, at least our attention is focused on this direction. Russian too, it's not for nothing that they keep reserves here and don't throw them at Marinka/Kurakhove.

Particular attention, of course, was paid to the use of government support measures. Experts from the Association have already conducted a survey of industrial enterprises in the region and identified two more industrial clusters for the creation, including an electrical engineering cluster and a cluster of building materials manufacturers, as well as the creation of 2 technology parks in the field of high technology.”

description: The Supreme Court of the Russian Federation upheld the ban on hijabs in Stavropol schools, confirming the regional government's resolution on introducing school uniforms.
original:
News from back in 2020. The Supreme Court recognized the ban on hijabs in Stavropol schools as legal. The administrative panel of the Supreme Court (SC) of the Russian Federation on Wednesday refused to satisfy the complaint of three residents of the Stavropol region who challenged the regional government’s ban on wearing hijabs in schools, a RAPSI correspondent reports from the courtroom .

Thus, the decision of the Stavropol Regional Court, which confirmed the legality of the regional government’s resolution on the introduction of school uniforms from the beginning of this year, came into force.

description: An exhibition dedicated to the history of the State Council and the Mariinsky Palace opened in St. Petersburg, marking the 180th anniversary of the palace's completion. The exhibition features unique documents from the Russian Federation's archives, including the book of oath of State Council members and Emperor Alexander I's manifesto on the council's establishment.
original:
An exhibition dedicated to the history of the State Council and the Mariinsky Palace opened in St. Petersburg
The exhibition is dedicated to the history of the State Council and the Mariinsky Palace and is located in the exhibition hall of the federal archives in St. Petersburg.
Show more
The exhibition was timed to coincide with the 180th anniversary of the completion of the Mariinsky Palace. The exhibition was organized by the Federal Archival Agency and the Russian State Historical Archive together with the Legislative Assembly of St. Petersburg. Deputies of the Legislative Assembly Natalia Astakhova, Lyubov Egorova, Alexander Kushchak and Alexander Novikov took part in the opening ceremony of the exhibition.
Among the exhibits of the exhibition are originals of unique documents from the archives of the Russian Federation: the book of oath of members of the State Council from 1810 to 1917, the manifesto of Emperor Alexander I on the establishment of the State Council, which he signed on January 1, 1810.
#ZakSSPb

description: The Russian Armed Forces launched a missile attack on Kyiv using Kh-101/Kh-555/Kh-55 aeroballistic and cruise missiles. The air alert lasted for almost 3 hours, with a 44-day pause in attacks on the Ukrainian capital. Ukrainian air defense forces managed to hit nearly 30 enemy missiles, but falling debris damaged administrative buildings, civil infrastructure, and private transport, resulting in at least 10 injured.
original:
The Russian Armed Forces attacked Kyiv with Kh-101/Kh-555/Kh-55 aeroballistic and cruise missiles. According to the KMVA, the air alert in Kyiv lasted for almost 3 hours. The enemy kept a pause for 44 days without striking the Ukrainian capital. During the combat operation, the air defense forces managed to hit almost 30 enemy missiles. Falling debris was recorded in several areas - administrative, civil infrastructure and private transport were damaged. KMVA reports on two wounded, but earlier Kyiv Mayor Vitaliy Klitschko noted at least 10 injured.

Hundreds of residents of the Ukrainian capital were at metro stations during massive missile strikes by the Russian Armed Forces. Send news to Fokus.|Watch Fokus' YouTube channel.

description: During towing to the hangar for maintenance at Krasnoyarsk Airport, the shear pins of the towing unit were destroyed. A detailed inspection revealed damage to the towing bracket, which was replaced. The aircraft, RRJ-95, RA-89146, operated by Rossiya Airlines JSC, has been cleared for flights after repairs.
original: Krasnoyarsk Airport (Emelyanovo) 03/11/2024 at 23.06 (Moscow time) during the process of towing the aircraft to the Hangar for maintenance, the shear pins of the towing unit were destroyed. ITP carried out a detailed inspection of the front landing gear and the wing fastening elements. Damage to the towing bracket has been detected. The bracket for the towing unit POSH was replaced, the mounting bolts for the towing unit POSH were dismantled and installed. Installation of new shear pins for the towing unit pin of the shock absorber strut has been completed. The aircraft is cleared for flights. Aircraft RRJ-95, RA-89146. Operator: Rossiya Airlines JSC.

description: During a Baltic Fleet exercise, a Navy missile hit the trawler Captain Lobanov, killing 3 crew members and injuring 4. The incident occurred on March 19. Authorities initially reported a fire on board, but a relative of a crew member revealed the true cause of the incident. The wounded were interrogated by FSB officers and asked not to discuss the incident.
original:
Forwarded from: ASTRA
The trawler "Captain Lobanov" sank after it was hit by a Navy missile during an exercise. A relative of a crew member told Dozhd about this. According to him, on March 19, as a result of a missile hitting the ship, 3 crew members were killed and four were injured. The missile was fired during a Baltic Fleet exercise, he claims.

The government of the Kaliningrad region claims that there was a fire on board the trawler. According to the authorities, one person died as a result of the incident. “When the survivors were taken away, everyone knew perfectly well that three people had died. And everyone knew perfectly well that a rocket had hit. But they decided to write that there was a “fire.” I wonder what kind of fire this is, if the captain’s cabin is completely gone, it was simply demolished,” says Dozhd’s source.

The victims, according to the interlocutor, are in a hospital in the city of Pionersk, and one of them is in serious condition. At the hospital, the wounded were allegedly interrogated by FSB officers, who asked the crew members “not to talk about the incident.”

Earlier, the TV channel, based on open data from the automated tracking system AIS, found out that “Captain Lobanov” could have entered the training area of the Baltic Fleet of the Russian Navy.

event: Unveiling of Memorial Plaque to Witold Shcholgin
description: A memorial plaque was unveiled in Lviv to honor Witold Shcholgin, a Polish architect, scientist, and writer. However, the plaque did not mention his Polish nationality, sparking controversy. The architect's family deemed the plaque 'unacceptable' and claimed they were not involved in the project.
original:
In Lviv on March 10, we unveiled a memorial plaque to Witold Shcholgin, a Polish architect, scientist and writer. He was the author of books, poems and radio stories about the city, written in Balaka, the Lviv dialect.

But on the sign installed on the eve of the 101st anniversary of his birth in the house where he lived from birth until 1946, it was not indicated that he was a Pole. And the name Vitold Shcholgine is written in Ukrainian. The architect's family said the memorial plaque in this form was simply "unacceptable."

At the same time, according to the Ukrainians, family members “did not see this project and were not interested in this issue at all” and, despite receiving an invitation to the official opening, did not contact the organizers.📌Earlier in 2021, in the same Lviv, a similar situation occurred at on the occasion of the opening of a memorial plaque in honor of the writer Stanislaw Lem.
Lviv. It also did not mention the nationality of the author. Although the famous futurist quote was placed on the sign: “I am a Lviv citizen and will remain a Lviv citizen until my death.”🔻Representatives of the Polish consulate in Lviv were not present at the opening ceremony of the Shcholgina memorial plaque. During the discussion, Arthur Jacques wrote that “this should have been a joint initiative of the city or municipal structures and the Polish consulate, therefore, having discovered inconsistencies with the preliminary design, the consulate rightly boycotted this event.” mojej nieobecności we Lwowie nie mogłem uczestniczyć w odsłonięciu tablicy pamiątkowej Witolda Szolgini na ścianie domu przy ulicy Łyczakowsk...

description: The Our Sport Foundation has restored around 15 sports facilities in Donbass and Novorossiya. The foundation is working to restore the physical culture and sports sphere in the DPR, LPR, Zaporozhye, and Kherson regions, including the construction and equipping of sports facilities.
original:
About 15 sports facilities have been restored in Donbass and Novorossiya by the Our Sport Foundation

About 15 sports facilities have been restored in Donbass and Novorossiya with the support of the Our Sport Foundation. The executive director of the fund, Rifat Biktashev, told the Donetsk News Agency about this.

“For 2024, we are now analyzing all objects in all regions. To date, about 15 objects have been restored in all four (historical regions - DAN’s note) and, among other things, we are also building open-type sites, GTO sites, so that athletes and children of any age can be tested and receive a GTO badge,” noted agency interlocutor.

The Our Sport Foundation is engaged in assisting in the restoration of the sphere of physical culture and sports in the DPR, LPR, Zaporozhye and Kherson regions. In particular, the restoration and construction of sports facilities (institutions, stadiums, playgrounds) and their equipping with equipment. It was created in March 2023.@gorlovka6tv

Critics argue that this decision erases Ukraine's cultural heritage and the memory of its heroes who fought against Nazism in World War II.
original:
⚡️The Museum of the Second World War in Kyiv announced the dismantling of all monuments of the Soviet era: “The plans include a maximum change in the architectural landscape: the dismantling of all monuments and elements of Soviet propaganda.” Even the high relief “Battle of Kursk” was planned to be demolished. In the comments, many criticized this decision: - “What, the fight in World War II is already some kind of shame? It’s a shame to destroy our cultural heritage. But what instead? Will you paint a mural with Bandera?” - “I’m ashamed of you and for the fact that what are you doing. In many countries of Europe and not only they honor the heroes who fought against Nazism in World War II. Ukraine lost in that war, let me remind you, 10 million people, so that now the memory of their feat is destroyed. Shame." - “Something is not I remember monuments - "elements of propaganda" on the territory of the museum. If we are talking about the composition of the "crossing of the Dnieper", then it is logical that such a monument is located in the museum of the Second World War. And not a single law classifies it as Soviet symbols or propaganda." - "Ukraine lost about 9 million people during World War II. Instead of focusing with experts on the decommunization of Soviet symbols, you talk about “dismantling.” This is inappropriate at least in relation to the fact that Ukrainians, unfortunately, took part in World War II in the ranks of different parties, including the Red Army. As a resident of Kiev, as a connoisseur of architecture, I don’t understand this decision.” How eager are the authorities to erase everything about the victory, including Ukraine, in the great war. No one should remember that Ukrainians were among those who defeated fascism!

What should we be proud of instead? Defense of the Bakhmut fortress or Zelensky’s counter-offensive?

description: A court dispute in Mariupol's Central district occupation administration has led to a riot. The issue revolves around the construction of mortgaged housing at 87 Lenin Street, where residents of dismantled buildings are supposed to be resettled. The developer, RKS-Novoroiya, is unwilling to provide apartments to the residents, while the administration is caught between satisfying the residents and not offending the developer.
original:
Forwarded from: Andryushchenko Time
About yesterday's court riot. Reasons, consequences and why something happened to the breadwinner in the occupation administration. In mid-February, the head of the district occupation administration of the Central (October in the occupiers) district of Mariupol, O. V. Kiryakulov. informed the residents of the dismantled buildings at 75b Myru (House with a clock), 77 Myru, and 47 Metalurgiv that: Morgun has applied for the construction of mortgaged housing at 87 Lenin Street, where they are supposed to be resettled. As they say in the pseudo-administrations, for p#zdlyvykh 75, 77 and 47 houses, at the same time, the order regarding the provision of the land plot to the developer, signed by Pushylin, is being contested in court. On the basis of this order, the administration of the city of Mariupol allocated this site.
But since on the one hand, the beneficiary of RKS-Novoroiya (read FSB+Marat Khusnuulin), and on the other "p#zdlyvye 75, 77 and 47", who complained to Putin's control - the twine is still the same.
They have to somehow simultaneously satisfy the residents without offending the developers. And the developer does not want to give Mariupol residents a single apartment. Therefore, how to untie the Gordian knot - khz. The administration on the sidelines insists on simply arresting and deporting the FSB's "criminals 75, 77 and 47" as if they don't mind, but on the other hand, there may be a "hello" from Putin's administration through Pushilin.
In short, if you ever need an example of congitive dissonance, this situation is the best. Ah yes. About the "Russian breadwinner". Let's look at the document (complaint) and what do we see? Right. "our house was destroyed by an airstrike." For now, this is the first and so far the only direct statement of Mariupol residents on paper during the occupation about the destruction of the city by aerial bombs. So Russian, bread?

description: Actor Nikita Kologrivy was arrested for seven days for rowdy behavior in a Novosibirsk bar. He got into a fight, insulted employees, hit the bartender, and bit a female administrator on the leg.
original:
Medusa - LIVEVideo, Actor from “The Boy’s Word” Nikita Kologrivy was detained in Novosibirsk. He got into a fight in a restaurant and bit...Nikita Kologrivoy was arrested for seven days for rowdy behavior in a Novosibirsk bar. At the trial, the actor asked to “understand and forgive” him. The decision on administrative arrest against the actor was made by the Central District Court of Novosibirsk. Kologrivy was sentenced to seven days of arrest under the article of petty hooliganism.

During the hearing, Nikita Kologrivy addressed the judge. The actor called himself a decent person who “may make a mistake,” but is “honestly ready to answer for it.” “I ask the court to pardon me, because a children’s hospital is waiting for me in Novosibirsk, the Church of Alexander Nevsky and many charitable things <...> I ask everyone of me understand and forgive,” the actor added. According to Kologrivy, during the night in the special detention center he realized that “it would be better to do charity work than some kind of stupidity.” The actor also stated that he apologized to the employees and management of the bar where he caused a row on the night of March 19.

After the verdict was announced, Kologrivy said that he agreed with the court’s decision and repented. “I’ll go sit on the kitsch and write poetry. Maybe something bright will come to my mind,” he added.

———

Nikita Kologrivogo was detained in Novosibirsk on March 20 after he caused a brawl in the Tangiers Lounge bar. According to the case file, on the night of March 19, while drunk, the actor had an argument with the bar employees: he insulted them, hit the bartender, and also pestered the female administrator and bit her on the leg.
