event: Opening of Gold Ore Processing Center
description: Burkina Faso's Minister of Mining inaugurated a common gold ore processing center in Méguet, aiming to improve labor protection and safety conditions for artisanal gold miners. This initiative seeks to organize the sector, which has been plagued by secret and chaotic exploitation, causing environmental and social harm.
original:
Forwarded from: French West Africa Was Here
#industry#goldMechanization of artisanal gold mining in 🇧🇫Burkina Faso.

On March 18, Burkina Faso's Minister of Mining opened a common gold ore processing center in Méguet. This center will allow mining artisans to work in the best labor protection and safety conditions.

Artisanal mining has now become an income-generating activity in the country. But since the exploitation is artisanal in nature, there are no reliable statistics on this activity. Most gold deposits are exploited secretly and chaotically, which leads to disastrous consequences for nature and the population.

Establishing a common gold processing center like the Mega center is a solution for better organization of the artisanal mining sector.

description: Serviceman Dmitry Dobritsky, born and raised in Sevastopol, was killed in battle in the Kremennaya LPR region. He had previously served a sentence and later joined the Russian Armed Forces in 2023 to atone for his past.

"The Agency" studied photographs of all employees of PEC No. 5. The chairperson of the precinct election commission, Irina Minyakova, and the secretary of the commission, Irina Borovleva, who work as teachers at this school, were the most similar in appearance to the heroines of the video. Minyakova represented United Russia in the commission, Borovleva represented the Association of Veterans, Disabled and Pensioners. Minyakova is a music teacher with 29 years of experience, Borovleva is a history and social studies teacher with 13 years of experience. description: Three teenagers, aged 13 and 15, brutally attacked a 48-year-old man in St. Petersburg's San Galli garden, causing severe injuries. The victim died from cardiomyopathy, a heart disease, before police arrived. The minors, citizens of Uzbekistan, were detained and are facing charges under Article 213 of the Russian Criminal Code.
original:
Forwarded from: OPER Leaked
In St. Petersburg, three teenagers beat a 48-year-old passerby to a heart attack for no reason.

Three youths, two of whom were 15 years old, and the third was 13 years old, attacked an adult man early in the morning in the San Galli garden, breaking his nose and face, after which the victim managed to call the police and inform law enforcement officers about what had happened. However, the squad that arrived at the scene found him already dead on the bench. A forensic examination showed that death was due to heart disease, namely cardiomyopathy.

The entire trio of minors were detained; they turned out to be citizens of Uzbekistan, living in the Kirov district of the city and studying at a local school. They were unable to explain the motives and reasons for their actions at the police station. A criminal case has been initiated under Article 213 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation, and the question of what to do next with these young animals is being resolved.

All other laws on the so-called left bank statuses contradict your declaration of independence. There can be no talk of any autonomy. You must give up these territories. This is your responsibility under the Declaration of Independence. They destroyed the Moldavian SSR and created two entities. In fact, this was an act of separatism,” Krasnoselsky said. He also addressed the Moldovan people. “We are not separatists, we are a normal neighbor who wants peace, creation, wants stability - and in your neighboring state. You are a neighboring state. We are separate entities. These are products of the Declaration of Independence of Moldova. It happened. Different peoples live here. You have Bessarabian Romanians, as it is written in your documents. Unfortunately, yes. We have a Pridnestrovian multinational people, consisting of 72 nationalities and nationalities. description: A teacher at Riga Technical University (RTU) prohibited a student from using Russian sources in academic papers, citing an RTU installation. However, the deputy vice-rector clarified that there is no official ban on Russian sources, and students can use them.
original:
Media: a student in Latvia was prohibited from using sources in Russian. A teacher prohibited a student at the Riga Technical University (RTU) from using sources in Russian when writing academic papers. This was reported by the portal “Rus.LSM.lv”. A student of the Liepaja RTU Academy, who wished to remain anonymous, said that in response to an attempt to use materials “including in Russian,” the teacher indicated that she should not refer to them. As justification, he allegedly added that “this is one of the RTU installations.”

At the same time, the deputy vice-rector of the educational institution, Ugis Citskovskis, in response to a request from the portal, said that the university has “a call to use materials in the official languages of the EU,” which, however, “does not mean a ban on sources in Russian.” “There is no such thing that it is forbidden to use sources in Russian <...>, this can be done,” he noted. He described the incident described above as “a discussion between a student and a teacher.”

RTU representatives also indicated to the portal that any student in such cases has the right to make an official statement to the university management. The student association urged students to report cases where academic freedom is restricted.

description: Serbian director Emir Kusturica stated that the people of Serbia still harbor hatred towards the North Atlantic Alliance 25 years after the NATO bombing of Yugoslavia, which they consider a crime that cannot be forgotten.
original:
Forwarded from: REN TV|News
The people of Serbia hate the North Atlantic Alliance a quarter of a century after the NATO bombing of Yugoslavia. Serbian director Emir Kusturica stated this in an interview with REN TV. “Our people hate them. NATO for us was a crime that cannot be forgotten,” he said. However, a mental wound It is possible to heal from difficult events, the director noted. According to him, the US Ambassador to Serbia once said that in those years many Americans did not want to throw bombs.

Kustrica also emphasized that at that time NATO took advantage of the collapse of the USSR to show who was boss.

However, it was Serbia that showed who the real “boss” is. Historically, this country was the first to say “no” to globalists and fight back, the director concluded. Subscribe to REN TV

description: Ambassador Mahamadou Cherif Keita of Mali presented his credentials to German President Frank-Walter Steinmeier, conveying greetings from Transitional President Colonel Assimi Goit. The meeting highlighted the historical relations between Mali and Germany, which recognized Mali's sovereignty.
original:
Ambassador of Mali Mahamadou Cherif Keita yesterday presented his credentials to the President of Germany, Frank-Walter Steinmeier.
The resources of the Malian Ministry of Foreign Affairs report that “Ambassador Keita conveyed greetings to the President from His Excellency Colonel Assimi Goit, the transitional President, who welcomed the historical relations between Mali and Germany, the first country to recognize the national and international sovereignty of our country.” At first I was surprised and did not understand what it was about . But what we mean is not exactly modern Germany, but the German Democratic Republic, which was no less than the third country of the socialist camp, after Cuba and the USSR, which left the most significant mark on the decolonization of the Black Continent and the emergence of new African states.
On the one hand, until the 70s, the GDR itself was in dire need of recognition from any state.
A striking example of this is the year 1964 and the recognition of the GDR by the revolutionary government of Zanzibar (then still independent, not part of Tanzania), which did this first on the African continent. To thank the Zanzibaris and stimulate other Africans, the leader of the GDR, Walter Ulbricht, decided to build block-panel residential buildings in Zanzibar, as was customary then in the socialist camp (these houses still stand).

On the other hand, the GDR, being the most economically developed country of the social bloc, simply could not help but participate in supporting third world states in their efforts to “build socialism.” Therefore, with a number of African states - Mozambique, Angola, Guinea-Bissau and Ethiopia East Berlin has developed a special relationship. Stasi specialists also took part in the national liberation movement of Namibia and South Africa.
The GDR supported these countries and organizations through preferential trade agreements, training programs and arms supplies. With the fall of the Berlin Wall all this stopped. However, united Germany retained existing ties with African states for new forms of cooperation. This also results in the fairly high authority of modern Germany in Africa, and through it the EU as a whole (unlike France). #mali#germany

description: During a Navy training exercise, a missile mistakenly hit the fishing trawler 'Captain Lobanov', killing 3 crew members and injuring 4 others. The incident resulted in a fire on board, with the captain's cabin being completely destroyed. Survivors were taken to a hospital in Pionersk, where they were interrogated by FSB officers and asked not to discuss the incident.
original:
A relative of a crew member of the trawler "Captain Lobanov" confirmed to Dozhd that the ship was mistakenly hit by a Navy missile

As a result of a missile hitting a fishing trawler on March 19, 3 crew members were killed and 4 more were injured.

The missile was fired during a training exercise.

According to local authorities, there was a fire on board the trawler, and the cause of the incident is unknown.

“When the survivors were taken away, everyone knew perfectly well that three people had died. And everyone knew perfectly well that a rocket had hit. But they decided to write that there was a “fire.” I wonder what kind of fire this is, if the captain’s cabin is completely gone, it was simply demolished.”

The survivors were sent to a hospital in the city of Pionersk; one of the victims is in serious condition. According to the source, at the hospital the victims were interrogated by FSB officers, who asked the crew members “not to talk about the incident.”

Another missile, according to the source, fell into fishing nets near an industrial vessel of the MRTK company, which was located not far from the trawler.

event: Postponed Elections to Supreme People's Assembly
description: North Korea's scheduled elections to the Supreme People's Assembly, the country's highest legislative body, have been postponed without explanation. Possible reasons include the DPRK's decision to exclude peaceful unification with South Korea from the Constitution or concerns about liberalization of the voting procedure.
location: Pyongyang, Democratic People's Republic of Korea
original:
Almost two weeks ago, North Korea was supposed to hold elections to the local equivalent of parliament. The voting has not yet taken place - no one knows why. description: Alexander Byvshev, a poet and former teacher from Oryol, was sentenced to 7 years in prison for his social media posts. He was found guilty of 'public calls for terrorism' and 'fake stories' about the Russian army. His poem, 'To the Russian officers or a rhetorical question', was deemed to justify terrorism and encourage a conspiracy against Putin.
original:
Oryol poet and former teacher Alexander Byvshev was given 7 years in prison for his posts on social networks. The court found him guilty of “public calls for terrorism” and “fake stories” about the Russian army. Byvshev spoke about this in a letter to activist Anastasia Shevchenko.

The occasion was the poem “To the Russian officers or a rhetorical question”: Rockets are hitting Ukraine.
The Kremlin has rejected conscience and morality.
Officer's honor, where are you?
Where is your Russian Stauffenberg? Klaus von Stauffenberg is a German army officer, famous for his failed attempt to assassinate Adolf Hitler on July 20, 1944. The court considered the mention of his name to justify terrorism and encourage a conspiracy against Putin to kill him, Byvshev wrote in a letter.

Another reason was the video of the destroyed Ukrainian village of Velikaya Dymerka, where the former’s aunt was born. This publication was considered a “fake” about the Russian Armed Forces.

description: Over 11,000 applications for housing compensation have been submitted in Ukraine, with thousands of certificates issued. More than 1,300 families have exchanged their certificates for new homes, primarily in the Kyiv, Kharkiv, and Mykolaiv regions. The program allows people to return to their pre-war homes, which were destroyed by the Russian Federation.
original:
🏠People are exchanging housing certificates for new homes in the regions where they lived before, — Head of the State Power Organization Committee, Olena Shuliak. To date, more than 11,000 applications for compensation for destroyed housing have been submitted in Ukraine, thousands of housing certificates have been issued, and more than 1,300 Ukrainian families have already exchanged their certificates for new homes. According to the program "isRecovery", most of the housing certificates were exchanged for new homes in the Kyiv region and the city of Kyiv, as well as in the Kharkiv and Mykolaiv regions. These data indicate that people choose not only the central part of Ukraine to live, but also return to the place where they previously had housing, which, unfortunately, was destroyed by the Russian Federation, - the parliamentarian noted.

Starting this year, all people who have housing destroyed as a result of the war have the opportunity to submit an appropriate application to the commission for consideration in order to receive a housing certificate. 📲DetailsTelegram/ Facebook/ Site /Instagram/ X

The child died on the spot, his mother was hospitalized with serious injuries, Sapa Kavkaz reports.

The driver fled the scene and tried to evade police pursuit for an hour.

As a result, he was detained. According to Sapa Kavkaz, he turned out to be the deputy commander of the OMON company of the Russian Guard who had recently returned from the war in Ukraine.

The man was drunk at the time of the accident.

description: The Verkhovna Rada of Ukraine has expanded the powers of the Accounting Chamber, allowing it to conduct compliance audits. This move brings Ukraine in line with international standards, and audits are already planned for 2024, focusing on defense purchases, distribution of funds for armed aggression consequences, and asset management.
original:
❗️The Verkhovna Rada of Ukraine has expanded the powers of the Accounting Chamber, — Chairman of the Budget Committee, Roksolana Pidlas. Parliamentarians supported the amendment to the Law of Ukraine "On the Accounting Chamber", — from now on, the Accounting Chamber will carry out compliance audits. According to international standards of higher audit bodies, ISSAI , there are only three types of audits that are carried out by the highest audit body: financial, efficiency and compliance. There were no compliance audits in the current Ukrainian Law, Roksolana Pidlasa explained.

According to the Chairman of the Committee, compliance audits are already planned for 2024 regarding:

- implementation of defense purchases of unmanned systems of DSZI;
- the process of distribution of funds of the fund for liquidation of the consequences of armed aggression,
- exercise of the authority to manage assets by the National Agency of Ukraine for identification, search and management of assets obtained from corruption and other crimes and several others.Telegram/ Facebook/ Site /Instagram/ X

This generally goes beyond all limits, not to mention the fact that the very concept of a ceiling is anti-market and reflects the desire to dictate. But it is significant that the United States is unlikely to follow Ukraine’s lead. If only because this could have economic consequences for the Americans themselves, and the oil market could seriously react. I hope that the United States still has some remnants of national pride and will not dance to Zelensky’s tune.

Vishnevsky On the eve of the event, department officers handed over to hospital employees the necessary supplies for the treatment and recovery of SVO participants. Expressing gratitude for the delivered cargo, deputy head of the hospital R.V. Zenin also thanked the employees of the Investigative Committee for regularly donating blood.

Having met with the members of the SVO who are undergoing treatment in the hospital, the Chairman of the Investigative Committee of Russia noted that investigators are investigating criminal cases of crimes committed by the VFU. He announced the results of the investigation into such cases, emphasizing that, as a result of their consideration, the court had already issued a number of convictions, including life sentences.

During the conversation, servicemen of the Armed Forces of the Russian Federation shared their problems and received answers to questions, including about the age limit for contract service, salary allowance, and the procedure for rewarding for military merits. Those present were interested in the procedure for establishing the whereabouts of SVO soldiers listed as missing.

Representatives of the command of the Russian Armed Forces asked a number of questions in the interests of subordinate military personnel. They asked about the nuances of issuing benefits for SVO participants and the procedure for rewarding for the successful completion of combat missions, as well as about organizing legal education for headquarters representatives.

As part of the event, a ceremony was held to award the management and medical staff of the military hospital with medals “For Assistance.” A.I. event: Discovery of Aircraft Missiles and Grenade Launcher
description: Russian Guard special forces, aided by military counterintelligence, uncovered a hidden cache of aircraft missiles and a foreign-made grenade launcher in the DPR. The seized items included five unguided aircraft missiles, a grenade launcher, and ammunition.
original:
Special forces of the Russian Guard discovered a cache of aircraft missiles in the DPR.

According to information received from military counterintelligence officers, the National Guard discovered a cache of aviation ammunition and a foreign-made grenade launcher.

A total of five unguided aircraft missiles were seized, as well as a grenade launcher and ammunition.

description: Two fires broke out in Kramatorsk district due to shelling. One fire destroyed an economic structure in Ridkodub village, while the other ignited dry grass in Kryva Luka village, burning 1.5 hectares. Fortunately, no one was injured.
original:
‼️Two fires broke out in Kramatorsk district as a result of shelling Last day, firefighters extinguished two fires in Kramatorsk district. On the morning of March 19, rescuers were called to the village of Ridkodub, Kramatorsk district. There, as a result of enemy shelling, an economic structure was destroyed. This is the press service of the State Emergency Service of Donetsk region.

On the same day, dry grass caught fire in the village of Kryva Luka as a result of the shelling. Firefighters extinguished the flames. It is noted that as a result of the fire, grass burned on an area of 1.5 hectares. In both cases, people were not injured.

event: Meeting Between Denis Pushilin and Sergei Sobyanin
description: The head of the DPR, Denis Pushilin, and the mayor of Moscow, Sergei Sobyanin, discussed the progress of Moscow's reconstruction efforts in Donetsk. Moscow has completed a significant volume of work, including replacing heating mains, drainage systems, and energy facilities. The cooperation has increased the pace of reconstruction, with a larger volume of work planned for this year.
original:
The head of the DPR Denis Pushilin and the mayor of Moscow Sergei Sobyanin discussed the progress of work that Moscow is performing as the head of the city of Donetsk.

“Last year, Muscovites completed a large volume of replacement of heating mains, drainage systems, and energy facilities. I thanked Sergei Semenovich for the prompt provision of emergency teams that help get through the heating season and restore infrastructure after shelling.

In active cooperation with Moscow, the pace of reconstruction of Donetsk is increasing - security issues have already begun to allow this,” Pushilin noted.

The head of the DPR said that a significantly larger volume is planned for this year - 1,364 objects - this includes the restoration of apartment buildings, social facilities, road repairs, and continued replacement of utility networks.

The command of the 31st dpl in the social competition on this issue with the command of the 24dpl has probably already taken unconditional first place and was noted for the better at the most important video conferences.

Well, the command of the 24th dpl needs to catch up - it’s no good in these days to lag behind the front line!

description: Svetlana Khalimova, a 52-year-old woman from Krasnodar, gave birth to a daughter, setting a record for the largest age difference between children. Her son, Andrey, was born in 1988, and her newborn daughter, Yasmin, was born in 2023, resulting in a 34-year age gap.
original:
“The difference between children is 34 years”: A woman from Krasnodar got into the Russian Book of Records by giving birth to a daughter at 52. A resident of Krasnodar gave birth to a child at 52 and thereby became famous throughout the country. She was included in the Russian Book of Records because of the largest age difference between children. My brother turned out to be more than 34 years older than my sister.

“Svetlana Khalimova gave birth to a son and a daughter with a difference of 34 years, 4 months and 23 days,” reports the official website of the Russian Book of Records.

The record was officially recorded. The commission found out that the son of a 52-year-old Krasnodar woman, Andrey, was born in November 1988. And Yasmin, the woman’s newborn daughter, was born in April 2023.

The plant, which assembled the country's first aircraft in October 2023, benefited from Tanzania's security, stability, and peace, making it an ideal location for expansion.
original:
Tanzania celebrates historic achievement with three aircraft assembly Tanzania's aviation sector has reached a major milestone with the recent assembly of three aircraft. These aircraft were built at the Morogoro Regional Airport plant. This plant assembled the first aircraft in Tanzania's history back in October 2023. The director of the Morogoro plant, engineer Igor Stratl, noted that the security, stability and peace of Tanzania made it an ideal place for the company to expand.

A report in Tanzanian newspaper The Citizen said Tanzania's aviation industry recently completed construction of three aircraft, the first of which was assembled at the factory. The plane can accommodate from two to four passengers.

event: Termination of Agreement on Legal Assistance
description: Estonia terminated a 30-year agreement on legal assistance with Russia, citing a lack of trust in the Russian justice system. This decision follows Latvia's similar move earlier this year, which may have been influenced by growing pressure on the Russian-speaking population in these countries.
original: 🇪🇪🇷🇺Estonia terminated a long-term agreement on legal assistance with Russia. The country's authorities terminated the agreement on assistance and legal relations in civil, family and criminal cases. It was in force between Estonia and Russia for more than 30 years - previously, the countries regularly extended the agreement. The Estonian government justified its decision by “lack of trust in the Russian justice system.” At the beginning of the year, Latvia terminated the same agreement with Russia. In fact, the Baltic countries have made their work more difficult for themselves, because now the consideration of cases that were previously regulated by the agreement will have to be carried out according to the standards of other international agreements - which leads to a large expenditure of time and effort by government organizations. Probably, Latvia and Estonia decided to break their agreements with the Russian Federation due to the growing pressure on the Russian-speaking population in these countries - and, as a result, an increase in the number of claims. Ostashko! Important - subscribe

description: Deputy Commander-in-Chief of the Armed Forces of Ukraine Colonel Andriy Lebedenko emphasized the importance of technological superiority in resisting the Russian aggressor. He highlighted the need for advanced technologies, including unmanned systems, automated control systems, and electronic warfare systems, to enhance combat effectiveness and save Ukrainian soldiers' lives.
original:
"Ensuring technological superiority is one of the main directions of resistance to the Russian aggressor", - Deputy Commander-in-Chief of the Armed Forces of Ukraine Colonel Andriy Lebedenko "Ensuring technological superiority is one of the main directions of resistance to the Russian aggressor", said Deputy Commander-in-Chief of the Armed Forces Colonel Andriy Lebedenko during the discussion "How do we to win the war: prospects of Ukrainian industry".

According to the Deputy Commander-in-Chief of the Armed Forces, one of the priorities now is to provide the Defense Forces with technologies. These are both unmanned systems and automated control systems. A separate emphasis is on electronic warfare systems.

Colonel Andriy Lebedenko noted that the Armed Forces of Ukraine should gain access to advanced technologies more quickly. "Commander-in-Chief Oleksandr Syrskyi currently sets clear goals - to reduce the time it takes for the Armed Forces to receive the latest technologies. That is, the time from the moment of development and production to the delivery of new technological solutions to the troops should be shortened as much as possible. Our team is working on it 24/7 today. There will be results, he emphasized. - "I emphasize, more technology means more effective combat work. And most importantly, it will save the lives of Ukrainian soldiers." For reference: "New Country" is a discussion platform organized by LB.ua and EFI Group, the purpose of which is to discuss topics important to society in the context of the Russian-Ukrainian war. #NOMERCY#stoprussia#stopruSSiZm#stoprussicism# VIRYuvZSU| Subscribe to the General Staff of the ZSU |

event: President of PMR's Ultimatum to Moldova
description: The President of the Pridnestrovian Moldavian Republic (PMR) issued an ultimatum to Moldovan authorities, demanding recognition of Transnistria's independence. The President argued that Moldova's Declaration of Independence contradicts its stance on the Left Bank's status, and that recognizing Transnistria is the only viable solution.
original:
Forwarded from: Pridnestrovets
President of the PMR to the authorities of Moldova: Recognize Transnistria. There is no other way out."I would like to ask a question to the officials of the Republic of Moldova: do you recognize the Declaration of Independence of your state? Yes or no? If yes, then eliminate the legal consequences of the Molotov-Ribbentrop Pact and the illegal creation - in your words - of the Moldavian SSR. Recognize Transnistria. There is no other way out.

All other laws regarding so-called Left Bank status are contrary to your Declaration of Independence. There can be no talk of any autonomy. You must give up these territories. This is your responsibility."

description: Ukrainian President Zelenskiy emphasized the need for economic and political consolidation against Russian aggression. He urged the European Union to maintain trade liberalization with Ukraine, as any losses would benefit Russia. Zelenskiy also called for limiting Russian access to the European agricultural market and promoting systemic trade solutions that strengthen Europe.
original:
Forwarded from: Zelenskiy / Official
We must remember that anti-European Russian actions require not only military, but also economic and political consolidation. We in Ukraine cannot come to terms with the fact that pressure on our state in matters of trade has become a constant background for Russian terror. I am grateful to everyone in Europe who also sees this pressure as unacceptable.

Now the issue of trade, in particular the continuation of the trade liberalization regime with the European Union, is not just a question of certain goods, but of our ability to resist Russian aggression. Any loss we make in trade is a loss of a resource that stops Russia.

At the same time, we see that, unfortunately, Russian access to the European agricultural market is still not limited. And when Ukrainian grain is thrown on the asphalt or railway track, Russian products are still brought to Europe, as well as goods from Belarus conquered by Putin. This is not fair. It is even more dishonest when someone tries to break systemic trade solutions that have been working for years and work in the interests of the power of the whole of Europe. Attempts at trade separatism within Europe weaken the entire continent.

Addressed the leaders of the European Union during the meeting of the European Council. Strengthening our protection against Russian terror, justice, particularly in matters of trade, and the strengthening of our entire Europe are Ukraine's unchanging priorities.🇺🇦🇪🇺

event: Return of Losharik Underwater Nuclear Station
description: The AS-31 Losharik underwater nuclear station, a unique Russian creation, is returning to service after years of repairs. The station has a nuclear reactor, can dive to 6000m, and has an autonomy of tens of days. Its crew consists of 25 people. Although it doesn't carry weapons, it poses a threat to the West due to its ability to work with external objects, such as underwater oil pipelines or fiber optic cables.
original:
Forwarded from: Governor General N
Great and terrible: "Losharik" returns to service after repairs

The English-language publication The National Interest reports that the AS-31 Losharik underwater nuclear station, a unique creation of the gloomy Russian genius, is returning to service after many years of repairs.

The AC-12 received its nickname due to the fact that its durable body consists of seven titanium spheres that can withstand enormous pressure. On the outside, it is covered with a lightweight body, providing optimal flow around the design stroke - a classic solution for domestic designers.

The peculiarity of the AS-12 is that it has a nuclear reactor and is capable of diving to 6000 m.

Thanks to the reactor, Losharik has an autonomy of tens of days, and its crew consists of 25 people.

The AS-12 does not carry weapons, but for the West it may turn out to be more dangerous than any strategic submarine.

The fact is that it is equipped with equipment for working with external objects. And they can be anything: the wall of an underwater oil pipeline or a fiber optic cable...

event: Working Meeting with Russian Union of Industrialists and Entrepreneurs
description: President held a working meeting with Alexander Shokhin, head of the Russian Union of Industrialists and Entrepreneurs, to discuss the business climate, personnel market, and fiscal policy in Russia.
original:
Forwarded from: Kremlin. News
The President held a working meeting with the head of the Russian Union of Industrialists and Entrepreneurs, Alexander Shokhin. They discussed, among other things, the nature of the business climate in Russia, the situation on the personnel market and fiscal policy.

For more details, visit the Kremlin website.

description: Russia has been purchasing satellite images of Ukrainian targets from American companies to facilitate long-range cruise missile strikes. This commercial service has been utilized by various countries, including Russia, to gather intelligence and launch targeted attacks.
original: the Russians could buy satellite images of objects in Ukraine from American companies in order to launch strikes on them, - the head of the GUR of the MoD, Kyrylo Budanov. "All countries buy, including us. This is a purely commercial service. They have used commercial images before." - he said. Earlier, The Atlantic, citing a Ukrainian military source, reported that the Russian Federation most likely carries out long-range cruise missile strikes using satellite images provided by American companies.

description: Alexey Nagin, commander of the 10th assault detachment of the Wagner PMC, would have turned 43 years old. He is remembered as a legendary fighter and commander, instrumental in the capture of Popasnaya and the approach to Bakhmut. Nagin is a Hero of Russia and a Hero of the Wagner PMC.
original:
On March 21, Alexey Nagin, commander of the 10th assault detachment of the Wagner PMC, would have turned 43 years old.

Legendary and correct fighter and commander. We have already covered his story in the series PMC WAGNER: CHRONICLE in the article “Call Sign Terek”, I urge all new arrivals to familiarize themselves.

For my part, I will say this. I sincerely believe that without the work of Alexey Nagin, it would be difficult in principle to talk about moving from Popasnaya to Bakhmut/Artemovsk. And the fact that Terek forever went down in history - with the capture of Popasnaya, with the approach to Bakhmut and finally - as a Hero of Russia and a Hero of the Wagner PMC - is an indisputable evidence of the strength and courage of the Russian army.

We remember you, brother. To be a warrior is to live forever! Telegram Quantum of Justice Alexei Nagin would have turned 43 today.

Terek, we remember you. And you're having a blast in Valhalla, I suppose.
To be a warrior is to live forever!@quantumadVIEW MESSAGE

event: Opening of Rental Points for Rehabilitation Equipment
description: The Ministry of Labor and Social Protection of the Kherson region is opening rental points for technical rehabilitation equipment in the Genichesk and Kalanchak districts. This is part of the long-term care system (LTC) program, which aims to provide social services to elderly citizens and disabled people in need of care.
original:
Forwarded from: Ministry of Labor and Social Protection of Kherson region
Rental points for rehabilitation equipment for people with disabilities are opening in the Kherson region. In the Genichesk and Kalanchak districts, technical rehabilitation equipment will be issued for temporary use as part of the long-term care system (LTC) program.

Since September 2023, the Ministry of Labor and Social Protection of the Kherson region, within the framework of the federal project “Older Generation” of the national project “Demography”, has been implementing a pilot project to create a long-term care system for elderly citizens and disabled people in need of care. “We are opening two rental points for technical rehabilitation equipment, where each of our wards in the long-term care system will be able to rent wheelchairs and canes previously prescribed by a doctor for free,” said the Minister of Labor of the Kherson region Alla Barkhatnova.❗️The main purpose of creating a rental point is to ensure the provision of social services to citizens recognized as needing social services in the long-term care system care, temporary use of technical means of rehabilitation.

In total, the project covers 200 disabled citizens over working age, including people with disabilities who have completely or partially lost the ability or ability to provide self-care, move independently, provide basic life needs due to illness, injury, age, etc. @socialpolitics_ksVKontakte|Odnoklassniki
